snp5.1:1.3: _Ākiñcaññaṁ_ could mean either “owning nothing” (per commentary, followed by Norman) or the “dimension of nothingness” (suggested by Bodhi). Given that just a little below we hear of him performing an expensive sacrifice; and further, that the dimension of nothingness is an important part of the conversation with of his students Upasīva and Posāla, the latter seems more likely. Anyway, “aspiring to own nothing” is hardly a noteworthy trait among ascetics.
